description.plain: John Newman is an English soul singer with an unique voice. With a UK #1 thanks to “Love Me Again”, it’s sure that he’ll see some success in the United States.

body.plain: John Newman is an English soul singer with an unique voice. With a UK #1 thanks to “Love Me Again”, it’s sure that he’ll see some success in the United States.

songs.full_title: Love Me Again by John Newman
songs.title: Love Me Again

description.plain:
In “Love Me Again”, John Newman asks his lover to take him back after a massive mistake on his part, complete with a religious soul vibe.

“Love Me Again” is the first single from John Newman. It has hit #1 in the UK.

songs.lyrics:
48 ContributorsTranslationsPortuguêsLove Me Again Lyrics[Verse 1]
Know I've done wrong
I left your heart torn
Is that what devils do?
Took you so low
Where only fools go
I shook the angel in you

[Pre-Chorus]
Now I'm rising from the ground
Rising up to you
Filled with all the strength I found
There's nothing I can't do

[Chorus]
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
Can you love me again?

[Verse 2]
It's unforgivable
I stole and burnt your soul
Is that what demons do?
They rule the worst of me
Destroy everything
They bring down angels like you
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
Now I'm rising from the ground
Rising up to you
Filled with all the strength I found
There's nothing I can't do

[Chorus]
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
(Can you love me again?)
Can you love me again?

[Bridge]
I told you once, I can't do this again
Do this again, oh lord
I told you once, I can't do this again
Do this again, oh no

[Chorus]
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
I need to know now, know now
Can you love me again?
I need to know now, know now
(Can you love me again?)
(Can you love me again?)
Can you love me again?
Can you love me again?88Embed

songs.title: Olé

description.plain:
“Olé” serves as the lead single for John Newman’s upcoming third studio album. The single was released on July 8, 2016.

“Olé” was written by the producer Calvin Harris, and much of the song’s buzz centers on the possibility that Calvin wrote it about his ex-flame, Taylor Swift, and her new boyfriend, Tom Hiddleston. The perspective of the song is characterized as “the other man” in an illicit love triangle—this suggests that Calvin believes Taylor was already pursuing Tom while she was still dating him.

Newman and Harris previously collaborated on the hit “Blame.”. Newman told Genius that they first met because of flapjack and bird feces:

My relationship with Calvin Harris started with a piece of flapjack and his car being covered in bird shit basically. He was in a studio in quite a rough part of London where I was working and I was laughing at his car being covered in bird droppings. He walked out at that moment in time and caught me laughing at that. It was the worst car I had ever seen. It was absolutely decimated in birds’ outgoings. We just started talking and he went off to buy some flapjack and we talked about making music together. It was a really natural progression musically and as friends. We’re both honest with each other, which is why this works

The upcoming “Olé” music video was shot in Mexico, Newman told Genius:

It’s based in Mexico. It’s basically a lavish lifestyle getaway but with a gimmick of laughing at the whole situation. It’s amazing because this whole kind of big, massive press thing went out. We were just on holiday. Imagine if we actually went on holiday like that. That would be mental like me me flying around on a Jetski and massive yacht with loads of good-looking women in high heels and makeup just walking around. My mom would kick my head in if I did that. We were making the video and it looks amazing. I saw the first edit today and it looks really good. It’s a stunning piece that quite surreal in some places. I don’t want to give away too much because it’s quite a different video to a lot videos at the moment so it’ll be a nice surprise for people.

When asked why he wants to continue working with Harris, Newman told Genius:

Success is a thing that will come and go. Throughout my career, I’ve seen my records sell tremendously well and I’ve seen them sell tremendously badly. I’m now prepared for both. The reason I want to work with Calvin Harris continuously is not because of his success; it’s because he’s quite a breakthrough with his ideas, he has a vision I share with him. It’s a natural partnership that feels so right to continue to work with.

songs.embed_content: Read “Olé” by John Newman on Genius

body.plain:
“Olé” serves as the lead single for John Newman’s upcoming third studio album. The single was released on July 8, 2016.

“Olé” was written by the producer Calvin Harris, and much of the song’s buzz centers on the possibility that Calvin wrote it about his ex-flame, Taylor Swift, and her new boyfriend, Tom Hiddleston. The perspective of the song is characterized as “the other man” in an illicit love triangle—this suggests that Calvin believes Taylor was already pursuing Tom while she was still dating him.

Newman and Harris previously collaborated on the hit “Blame.”. Newman told Genius that they first met because of flapjack and bird feces:

My relationship with Calvin Harris started with a piece of flapjack and his car being covered in bird shit basically. He was in a studio in quite a rough part of London where I was working and I was laughing at his car being covered in bird droppings. He walked out at that moment in time and caught me laughing at that. It was the worst car I had ever seen. It was absolutely decimated in birds’ outgoings. We just started talking and he went off to buy some flapjack and we talked about making music together. It was a really natural progression musically and as friends. We’re both honest with each other, which is why this works

The upcoming “Olé” music video was shot in Mexico, Newman told Genius:

It’s based in Mexico. It’s basically a lavish lifestyle getaway but with a gimmick of laughing at the whole situation. It’s amazing because this whole kind of big, massive press thing went out. We were just on holiday. Imagine if we actually went on holiday like that. That would be mental like me me flying around on a Jetski and massive yacht with loads of good-looking women in high heels and makeup just walking around. My mom would kick my head in if I did that. We were making the video and it looks amazing. I saw the first edit today and it looks really good. It’s a stunning piece that quite surreal in some places. I don’t want to give away too much because it’s quite a different video to a lot videos at the moment so it’ll be a nice surprise for people.

When asked why he wants to continue working with Harris, Newman told Genius:

Success is a thing that will come and go. Throughout my career, I’ve seen my records sell tremendously well and I’ve seen them sell tremendously badly. I’m now prepared for both. The reason I want to work with Calvin Harris continuously is not because of his success; it’s because he’s quite a breakthrough with his ideas, he has a vision I share with him. It’s a natural partnership that feels so right to continue to work with.

songs.lyrics:
26 ContributorsOlé Lyrics[Verse 1]
Lowkey, you won't tell none of your friends about me
You won't tell them I occupy your dreams and your thoughts
Look at what we have started
I feel so good when I leave your apartment

[Pre-Chorus]
I know, there's no telling how far you can go
And you don't want to hear about my love and my lust
Babe that I have been feeling
I kiss you once, then I stare at the ceiling

[Chorus]
Olé, you bring too much sunlight to my day
And only you can chase the pain away
You bring too much sunlight to my day, my day

[Verse 2]
My heart speaks
I ain't seen you or been with you for weeks
But I see online that you've begun to be
A good girl and take trips with your boyfriend
Being attentive, continue to pretend

[Pre-Chorus]
But no, 'cause there's no telling how far you can go
You've hidden my name on your phone so you can
Call me to tell me you've been going through hell
Left him alone and you booked in a hotel
You might also like[Chorus]
Olé, you bring too much sunlight to my day
And only you can chase the pain away
You bring too much sunlight to my day, my day

[Bridge]
I can't control myself around you
I can't control myself around you
I can't control myself around you
I can't control myself around you
I can't control myself around you
I can't control myself around you
And I'm singing...

[Outro]
Olé, you bring too much sunlight to my day
And only you can chase the pain away
You bring too much sunlight to my day, my day
Olé, you bring too much sunlight to my day
And only you can chase the pain away
You bring too much sunlight to my day, my day10Embed

songs.full_title: Fire in Me by John Newman
songs.title: Fire in Me

description.plain:
“Fire in Me” is the 2018 single, written and conducted by British singer and songwriter John Newman. It is the succeeding single to the Calvin Harris-produced “Ole” back in 2016.

The single was teased through social media as early as May 2017, with an August 2017 Instagram post indicating it would be released soon.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BYF5fRABkSH/?taken-by=johnnewmanmusic

However, the single was unfortunately delayed due to needing a few finishing touches with the aim of making the song the best it could be for fans.

The buzz was eventually revived when John Newman issued a countdown on 7 February 2018, saying that there is “4 weeks remaining” for something special on Twitter:

https://twitter.com/JohnNewmanMusic/status/961170621580349440

https://twitter.com/JohnNewmanMusic/status/961170697023303681

songs.embed_content: Read “Fire in Me” by John Newman on Genius
